member.name: T:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient
member.summary: This class contains the api calls that allow you to interact with your game.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Connect(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to connect to an Unreal game with GameDriver Agent configured and active. This function can connect to the unreal editor or a Standalone deployment of a game.
member.param: The hostname of the machine running the game.
The configured port that the GameDriver agent is configured to use.
The amount of time in seconds to wait for connectivity to establish with the game.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.ReConnect(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to disconnect and reconnect the API client to the Game. Useful after loading a new Scene when the agent is reloaded and requires reconnection.
member.param: The hostname of the machine running the game.
How long to wait (milliseconds) before attempting to reconnect.,
The configured port that the GameDriver agent is configured to use.
The amount of time in seconds to wait for connectivity to establish with the game.

example.code: //Reconnect after 5 seconds to a local instance of the Unreal editor with the default port of 15505 configured. api.ReConnect("10.0.0.20", 5000, 15505, 60));

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Use this function to disconnect the API client from the Game.

example.code: api.Disconnect();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectPosition(System.String,gdio.common.objects.CoordinateConversion,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the position of a specific object.
member.param: The HierarchyPath of the object to return the position of.
The coorindate space conversion to perform on the position before returning it. See for more information.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: The Vector3 position of the specific object.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectDistance(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns the distance of two objects using vector subtraction.
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the first UObject.
The HierarchyPath for the second UObject.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: Returns the distance between the two objects as a float.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectFieldValue``1(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns the field or property value of an object.
member.typeparam: The of the field or property to be inspected.
member.param: The HierarchyPath of the object and field/property to be inspected.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: Returns an object of type T for the value or throws an on error.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectFieldValue``1(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns the field or property value of an object.
member.typeparam: The of the field or property to be inspected.
member.param: The HierarchyPath of the object and field/property to be inspected.
The field/property name to retreieve the value for/
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: Returns an object of type T for the value or throws an on error.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.SetInputFieldText(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the text of a TextBox or EditableText
member.param: The HierarchyPath to the TextBox or EditableText
The text value to set in the field.
If TRUE, wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The time to wait for the object to exist.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent was able to successfully set the TextBox or EditableText text.

example.code: //Sets the TextBox component attached to the "TextMeshPro InputField" object with the tag "FilterInputTxt" to the value of "America" api.SetInputFieldText("//FilterInputTxt[@name='TextMeshPro InputField']", "America");

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.SetObjectFieldValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the field or property of an object.
member.param: The HierarchyPath to the object to set the field/property value.
The field or property name to set the value of.
The value to set for the field/property.
If TRUE, wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The time to wait for the object to exist.
member.returns: TRUE if the field/property was successfully set to the value.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.RotateObject(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Quaternion,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotate an object defined by the HierarchyPath and rotated by a Quaternion. for more information.
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object to rotate.
The quaternion value to manipulate the object.
Wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: api.RotateObject("//*[@name='Cylinder']", new Quaternion(0, 0, 2, 2), true);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.RotateObject(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector3,gdio.common.objects.Space,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotate an object defined by the HierarchyPath and rotated by Eulers. for more information.
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object to rotate.
The Eulers vector to manipulate the object.
The to perform the rotation relative to.
Wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Rotates an object with the name "Cylinder" by 30 degrees on the y axis. api.RotateObject("//*[@name='Cylinder']", new Vector3(0, 30, 0), Space.Self, true);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.RotateObject(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,gdio.common.objects.Space,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotate an object defined by the HierarchyPath and rotated by the x, y, and z angles relative to the Space
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object to rotate.
The X angle value to rotate.
The Y angle value to rotate.
The Z angle value to rotate.
The to perform the rotation relative to.
Wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Rotates an object with the name "Cylinder" by 20 degrees on the z axis api.RotateObject("//*[@name='Cylinder']", 0, 0, 20);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.RotateObject(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector3,System.Single,gdio.common.objects.Space,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotate an object defined by the HierarchyPath and rotated by the axis and angle, relative to the Space
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object to rotate.
The to perform the rotation relative to.
Wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Will rotate an object named "Cylinder" on all 3 axis by 45-degrees api.RotateObject("//*[@name='Cylinder']", new Vector3(0, 0, 0), 45);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetLastFPS
member.summary: This method returns the last frames per second that the API client has recieved from the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: The last published FPS as a double.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.CallMethod(System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to execute a method on an object.
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object that the script component is attached to.
The name of the method to call. (must be visible to blueprints to be called)
An array of objects to pass as arguments to the method.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed.
member.returns: Returns a boolean based on the successful execution of the return type void, method.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.CallMethod``1(System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to execute a method on an object.
member.param: The HierarchyPath for the object that the script component is attached to.
The name of the method to call.
An array of objects to pass as arguments to the method.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed.
member.returns: Returns a deserialized object of type T. If T and the type of the returned object don't match, an exception will be thrown.

example.code: gdio.common.objects.Color lightColor = api.CallMethod<gdio.common.objects.Color>("/ThirdPersonCharacter_167/fn:component('testLight')", "GetLightColor", null);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.KeyPress(gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to send arbitrary button states to the game. Defaults to LEFT ALT/CTRL/SHIFT/WINDOWS(COMMAND)
member.param: A reference to Keycode enums representing the possible keyvalues.
The number of frames to press and hold the keys for.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.WaitForObject(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an object to exist.
member.param: The HierarchyPath of the object.
The amount of time to wait for the object to exist.
member.returns: TRUE if the object exists within the alloted timeout.

example.code: api.WaitForObject("//*[@name='Cube']"); //Waits for an object named "Cube" to exist

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.WaitForObjectValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an object to exist and have a specific value for a specified field/property.
member.param: The HierarchyPath to the object.
The field/property name for inspection.
The value to wait for.
If TRUE, wait for the object to exist if it doesn't.
The amount of time to wait for the object to exist with the specified value.
member.returns: TRUE if the object exists with the specified value in the alloted timeout.

example.code: //Waits for the value of the TextMeshProUGUI input field with the name "Text" to be "America" api.WaitForObjectValue("//*[@name='Text']/fn:component('TMPro.TextMeshProUGUI')", "text", "America");

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.WaitForEmptyInput(System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an Empty Input event to be received.
member.param: The time to wait for the event.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetSceneName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the name of the current active scene.
member.param: The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: The name of the scene as a string.

example.code: string activeScene = api.GetSceneName();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.LoadLevel(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method loads the scene, defined by the scene name passed as an argument.
member.param: The name of the scene to load
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the request was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Loads the FinalBoss scene api.LoadScene("FinalBoss");

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Click(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in-game mouse-clicks.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The position to perform the mouse click.
The number of frames to click the specific position.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the Click request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

example.code: api.Click(MouseButtons.LEFT, new Vector2 (0, 0), 30, 30); //Clicks the left mouse button at 0,0 for 30 frames

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Click(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in-game mouse-clicks.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The X coordinate of the game to click in Screen space.
The Y coordinate of the game to click in Screen space.
The number of frames to click the specific position.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the Click request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

example.code: api.Click(MouseButtons.LEFT, 0, 0, 30, 30); //Clicks the left mouse button at 0,0 for 30 frames

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.ClickEx(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in-game mouse-clicks combined with key press operations. The total frame count of this operation is clickFrameCount + keysNumberOfFrames + modifiersNumberOfFrames
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The position to perform the mouse click.
The number of frames to click the specific position.
An array of keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.
An array of modifier keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the modifier keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.

Total time in milliseconds to wait after pressing modifier keys, before clicking the object. This is needed when a delay is required to register the modifier keys have been pressed in game. If this delay is longer than that of the frame count for all of the key presses and click operations, the resulting behavior may not be what the user intends.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the ClickEx request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

example.code: //Clicks the left mouse button at 0,0 for 30 frames while holding the left-shift key for 3 frames, and the C key for 5 frames. api.ClickEx(MouseButtons.LEFT, new Vector2(0, 0), 30, new KeyCode[] { KeyCode.C }, 5, new KeyCode[] { KeyCode.LeftShift }, 3, 500, 30);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.ClickEx(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in game mouse-clicks combined with key press operations. The total frame count execution of this operation is clickFrameCount + keysNumberOfFrames + modifiersNumberOfFrames.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The X coordinate of the game to click in Screen space.
The Y coordinate of the game to click in Screen space.
The number of frames to click the specific position.
An array of keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.
An array of modifier keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the modifier keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.

Total time in milliseconds to wait after pressing modifier keys, before clicking the object. This is needed when a delay is required to register the modifier keys have been pressed in the game. If this delay is longer than that of the frame count for all of the key presses and click operations, the resulting behavior may not be what the user intends.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the ClickEx request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.MouseDrag(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform a mouse drag operation.
member.param: The mouse button, , to perform the drag operation with.
The destination vector to drag the mouse to.
The number of frames taken to complete the drag operation.
The origin to start the drag operation. If null, the mouse drag operation will begin at the current position of Input.mousePosition.
Wait for the empty input event to be returned from the agent before returning from the method call.

The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent. If waitForEmptyInput is set to TRUE, then the method call will wait the timeout allotment to recieve the event.
member.returns: TRUE if the requests was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Drags the left mouse button to the position 180, 0 on the screen over 30 frames api.MouseDrag(MouseButtons.LEFT, new Vector2(180, 0), 30, , true);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.MouseMoveToObject(System.String,System.UInt64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the mouse to the center of a specific object, identified by the HierarchyPath.
member.param: The HierarchyPath to move the mouse pointer to.
The number of frames to compelte the mouse move over.
If TRUE, wait for the object to exist so that mouse move can complete successfully.
Wait for the empty input event to be returned from the GameDriver agent, before returning from the method.

The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent. If waitForEmptyInput is TRUE, then the method call will wait the timeout alotment to recieve the event.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Moves the mouse to the center of the object named "Cylinder" over 300 frames api.MouseMoveToObject("//*[@name='Cylinder']", 300, true, true);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.MouseMoveToPoint(gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the mouse to the destination vector.
member.param: Destination vector to move the mouse to.
The number of frames to complete the operaiton over.
The origin to start the mouse move operation. If null, the mouse move operation will begin at the current position of Input.mousePosition.
Wait for the empty input event to be returned from the GameDriver agent, before returning from the method.

The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent. If waitForEmptyInput is TRUE, then the method call will wait the timeout alotment to recieve the event.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.ClickObject(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.String,System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to interact with an in-game object using mouse-clicks.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The HierarchyPath for the GameObject to perform a click on.
The number of frames to click the specific object.

The number of frames to hold the keys down before clicking. Total press frame count is keyFrames + frames. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.ClickObjectEx(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.String,System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to interact with an in-game object using mouse-clicks combined with key press operations. The total frame count execution of this operation is clickFrameCount + keysNumberOfFrames + modifiersNumberOfFrames.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the click operation. See .
The HierarchyPath for the GameObject to perform a click on.
The number of frames to click the specific object.
An array of keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.
An array of modifier keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the modifier keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.

Total time in milliseconds to wait after pressing modifier keys, before clicking the object. This is needed when a delay is required to register the modifier keys have been pressed in the game. If this delay is longer than that of the frame count for all of the key presses and click operations, the resulting behavior may not be what the user intends.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the ClickObjectEx request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.DoubleClick(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in-game mouse double-clicks.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the double click operation. See .
The Vector2 location to double click in Screen space.
The number of frames to double click the specific position.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the Click request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

example.code: //Double-clicks the left mouse button at position 0, 0 on the screen over a duration of 30 frames. api.DoubleClick(MouseButtons.LEFT, new Vector2(0, 0), 30, 30);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.DoubleClick(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to perform in-game mouse double-clicks.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the double click operation. See .
The X coordinate of the game to double click in Screen space.
The Y coordinate of the game to double click in Screen space.
The number of frames to click the specific location.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the Click request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.

example.code: //Double-clicks the left mouse button at position 0, 0 on the screen over a duration of 30 frames. api.DoubleClick(MouseButtons.LEFT, 0, 0, 30, 30);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.DoubleClickObject(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,System.String,System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to interact with an object in game using a mouse double-click.
member.param: The mouse button to use for the double click operation. See .
The HierarchyPath for the GameObject to perform a double click on.
The number of frames to double-click the specific object.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the DoubleClickObject request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.DoubleClickEx(gdio.common.objects.MouseButtons,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,System.Int32,System.Int32)

The Vector2 position of where to double click in Screen space.
The number of frames to click the specific position.

The number of frames to press the keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.
An array of modifier keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the modifier keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.

Total time in milliseconds to wait after pressing modifier keys, before clicking the object. This is needed when a delay is required to register the modifier keys have been pressed in the game. If this delay is longer than the frame count for all the key presses and click operation that the behavior of the result may not be what the user intends.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the ClickEx request was processed. Input requests process asynchronously, so a response does NOT imply the input operation has completed.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

member.summary: Use this function to interact with an object in game using a mouse double-click, combinated with key press operations. The total frame count execution of this operation is clickFrameCount + keysNumberOfFrames + modifiersNumberOfFrames
member.param: The mouse button to use for the double click operation. See .
The HierarchyPath for the GameObject to perform a double-click on.
The number of frames to double-click the specific object.
An array of keys to press during the click operation.
The number of frames to press the keys parameter down. This parameter is not additive to the total count and is automatically accumulated by the function call.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.KeyPress(gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode[],System.UInt64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to send arbitrary button states to the game. Defaults to LEFT ALT/CTRL/SHIFT/WINDOWS(COMMAND)
member.param: An array of keys() to press.
The number of frames to press and hold the keys for.
An array of modifiers() to press.
The number of frames to hold the modifiers down for, before pressing the keys.
The delay to wait between holding the modifies and pressing the keys.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.CaptureScreenshot(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to capture a screenshot of the Game under test.
member.param: The filename, and path, of the screen capture.
If true, this won't transfer the screen capture back to the client and instead will save it on the device where the game is running.
If true, the operation will overwrite the file if it already exists.
The number of seconds to wait for a response that the CaptureScreenshot request was processed.

example.code: api.CaptureScreenshot(@"c:\temp\screen1.png", false, true);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Raycast(gdio.common.objects.Vector3,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform a Raycast to a point to find out what is in that position.
member.param: The vector to perform a raycast to.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: Returns an array of .

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.NavAgentMoveToPoint(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector3,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move a NavAgent to a destination point.
member.param: The HierarchyPath to the NavAgent.
The destination vector to move to.
Wait for the NavAgent move-to operation to complete before the method returns.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the method call was successfully processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Moves the 1st object named "Ellen" to position 20, 0, 20 on the NavMesh api.NavAgentMoveToPoint("//*[@name='Ellen']", new Vector3(20, 0, 20));

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.TouchInput(gdio.common.objects.Vector2,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Send a raw TouchInput event to the game.
member.param: Vector position of the start of the touch input.
Vector destination position of where the touch input ends.
The finder id of the touch input.
The number of taps that should be registered.
The number of frames to complete the tap input over.
If TRUE, wait for the Empty Input event to be broadcast before returning from the method.
The radius of the touch input.
The pressure of the touch input.
The altitude angle of the touch input.
The azimuth angle of the touch input.
The maximum possible pressure for the touch input.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent was able to process the request successfully.

example.code: //Performs a single touch input from 0,0 to 100, 100 with a single "finger" over a duration of 50 frames api.TouchInput(new Vector2(0, 0), new Vector2(100, 100), 0, 1, 50);

The Y coordinate of the end position.

The number of taps that should be registered.
The number of frames to complete the tap input over.
If TRUE, wait for the Empty Input event to be broadcast before returning from the method.
The radius of the touch input.
The pressure of the touch input.
The altitude angle of the touch input.
The azmulth ange of the touch input.
The maximum possible pressure for the touch input.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent was able to process the request successfully.

example.code: //Performs a single touch input from 0,0 to 100, 100 with a single "finger" over a duration of 50 frames api.TouchInput(0, 0, 100, 100, 0, 1, 50);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Tap(gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tap the handheld device at the defined position.
member.param: The vector position to tap the device screen.
The number of taps that should be registered.
The number of frames to complete the tap input over.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent was able to process the request successfully.

example.code: //Performs a single tap at position 0, 0 for 10 frames api.Tap(new Vector2(0, 0), 1, 10);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Tap(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tap the handheld device at the defined position.
member.param: The X coordinate of the position to tap the device screen.
The Y coordinate position to tap the device screen.
The number of taps that should be registered.
The number of frames to complete the tap input over.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.

example.code: //Performs a single tap at position 0, 0 for 10 frames api.Tap(0, 0, 1, 10);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.TapObject(System.String,System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tap an object.
member.param: The HierarchyPath of the object to tap.
The number of taps that should be registered.
The number of frames to complete the tap input over.
The HierarchyPath to the Camera rendering the object. An empty string uses Camera.main
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent was able to process the request successfully.

example.code: //Performs a single tap on an object with the name "Cube" api.TapObject("//*[@name='Cube']", 1, 10);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectList(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns of a list of all GameObjects as returned by , where Type is UnityEngine.GameObject./>
member.param: Generate full path for GameObjects
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: This method returns a of . LiteGameObject is a slimmer representation of UnityEngine.GameObject

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetObjectList(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)

member.param: HierarchyPath of objects to be returned
Generate full path for GameObjects
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.GetGameObject(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the UObject that evaluates from the provided HierarchyPath argument.
member.param: The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: The matching UObject, if it exists.

example.code: api.GetGameObject("//*[@name='MyObject']")

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.SetTimescale(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to set the play speed of the game. Can be used to speed up or slow down the game in order to improve test execution time. (https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Time-timeScale.html)
member.param: The coefficient of time.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.EnableObjectCaching(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enable the use of object caching when performing HierarchyPath object resolution. Object caching is per HierarchyPath stored in a . If a matching HierarchyPath is already in the dictionary, then the stored object is returned. The only way to update a cached reference is for the reference to be garbage collected or flush the cache with .
member.param: The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.EnableObjectCaching();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.DisableObjectCaching(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disable the use of object caching when doing HierarchyPath object resolution.
member.param: The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.DisableObjectCaching();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.FlushObjectLookupCache(System.Int32)
member.summary: If object caching is enabled, this method will request that the agent flush the cache being held for all object lookups.
member.param: The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.FlushObjectLookupCache();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.WaitForCollisionEvent(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for a collision event to fire on an element that is being monitored for collisions. If the method has been called before, there is the potential that another event was recieved before waiting on the event again.
member.param: The eventId received from the call.
The number of seconds to wait for a collision event to be fired.
member.returns: The contains information about the collision. NULL is returned if the request timesout.

example.code: api.WaitForCollisionEvent{object}(eventId);

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.UnregisterCollisionMonitor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregister the monitoring of collision events on a GameObject that has been previously registered for monitoring.
member.param: The id retunred when creating the collision listener.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.CreateInputDevice(System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to create a VR device (OculusHMD, etc).
member.param: The type of device to be created, according to a layout.
The custom name for the device. Can act as a tag of sorts.
TBD
Whether the name will have GDIO appended to it at the beginning.
The amount of time in seconds to wait for connectivity to establish with the game.

example.code: // Creates an Oculus headset device api.CreateInputDevice("OculusHMD", "GDIOOculusHMD", new string[] { "GDIOHMD" });

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.RemoveInputDevices(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to remove all devices that have the usage tag "GDIO".
member.param: The amount of time in seconds to wait for connectivity to establish with the game.

example.code: // Removes all devices and layouts with the tag "GDIO" api.RemoveInputDevices();

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.QuaternionInputEvent(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Quaternion,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to send arbitrary Quaternion Event states to the game.
member.param: The Input Control Path for the New Input System
Value of the Quaternion event
The number of frames to press and hold the axis for.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.QuaternionInputEvent("Left", api.EulerToQuat(-10, 0, 0), 5); //Turn controller by -10 degrees around its x axis.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Vector2InputEvent(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector2,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to send arbitrary Vector2 Event states to the game.
member.param: The Input Control Path for the New Input System
Value of the Vector2 event
The number of frames to press and hold the axis for.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.Vector2InputEvent("Right", new Vector2(0, 1), 2); //Move the right joystick up.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.Vector3InputEvent(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector3,System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this function to send arbitrary Vector3 Event states to the game.
member.param: The Input Control Path for the New Input System
Value of the Vector3 event
The number of frames to press and hold the axis for.
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.Vector3InputEvent("Left", new Vector3(0, 0, 5), 2); //Move the left controller to the coordinates relative to the HMD.

member.name: M:gdio.unreal_api.ApiClient.VRInput(System.String,gdio.common.objects.Vector3,gdio.common.objects.Quaternion,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convenience function to send arbitrary Vector3 with Quaternion Event states to the game for the HUD or controllers
member.param: The Device you added earlier (unused for now)
Value of the Vector3 event
Orientation.
0= HMD, 1= Left, 2 = Right
The timeout in seconds to wait for a response that the request was processed by the GameDriver agent.
member.returns: TRUE if the GameDriver agent successfully processed the request.

example.code: api.VRInput("Left", new Vector3(0, 0, 5), api.EulerToQuat(-10, 0, 0), 0); //Move the left controller to the coordinates relative to the HMD.

member.name: T:gdio.unreal_api.UE4.KeyCode
member.summary: Keycode is a mapping of EKeys from UnrealEngine.

member.name: T:gdio.unreal_api.UE5.KeyCode
member.summary: Keycode is a mapping of EKeys from UnrealEngine.
